page.title: 12SUTTON BONINGTON WASTE TIP
page.content: {Hathernware}began when they were building the Midland Railway, for clay deposits suitable for{brickmaking}were found.{Clay}was dug for one hundred years and a large hole left. The government regulations insist that the land is returned to its original state so local firms are bringing in their {rubble}and{dumping}it at a cost of Â£6.55. Household{rubbish}is not allowed because of the smell. The area is going to be landscaped and left for cattle to graze. In fifty years time the land will be suitable for building on. When they were building the railway they found the bones of a man and a horse. They did not find the clothes for the man so they believed that he was murdered during the Civil War. It is also planned to study an {Anglo Saxon}cemetery which was discovered in 1939.
